contentrichtext.text: {{Orphan|date=February 2009}} '''Tullio Moneta''' is a [[South Africa]]n actor. He acted in a dozen or more films between 1970 and 1990, starring in the feature film ''The Lion's Share''. He had a small <!-- uncredited? --> role in ''The Wild Geese'' (1978). In November 1981 Moneta was second-in-command to [[Mike Hoare]] when the latter led a coup attempt at [[Seychelles International Airport|Mahe Airport]] in the [[Seychelles]] and was sentenced to five years in prison.<ref>TDP Dugdale-Pointon [http://www.historyofwar.org/articles/people_hoare.html "Mike Hoare (Congo Mercenary) 1920-???"] 30 September 2005</ref><ref>UPI, ["http://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=9A04E6DE1339F933A05754C0A964948260 "South Africa Sentences Mercenary to 10 Years"], ''New York Times'', July 30, 1982</ref> Moneta lives in [[Durban, South Africa]]. ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Moneta, Tullio | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Actor and helped lead coup attempt in [[Seychelles]] | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Moneta, Tullio}} [[Category:South African actors]] [[Category:South African mercenaries]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Durban]] [[Category:South African people of Italian descent]] [[Category:White South African people]] {{SouthAfrica-actor-stub}}
